content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format.(For each problem, you need to provide your thought process and ultimately present the conclusion in the form of "Therefore, the final answer is: ")

To find the shortest path from node 7 to node 8 in the given graph, we can use the Breadth-First Search (BFS) algorithm. We will start exploring nodes from the start node and move towards the destination node while keeping track of the paths.

Starting from node 7, we can visit the neighboring nodes 11 and 9. From node 11, we have only one neighbor 7 (which we have already visited), and from node 9, we can visit node 3. From node 3, we can visit node 9 (which we have already visited) and node 10.

Therefore, the final answer is: 7->9->10->8

To find the shortest path from node 7 to node 8 in the given graph, we can once again use the Breadth-First Search (BFS) algorithm starting from node 7.

Starting from node 7, we can visit nodes 11 and 9. From node 11, we have already visited node 7, and from node 9, we can visit node 3 and node 10. From node 3, we have already visited nodes 9 and 11. From node 10, we can visit nodes 6 and 9.

In this case, we can see that there is no path from node 7 to node 8.

Therefore, the final answer is: There is no path from node 7 to node 8.
